body_html: I don't think this is a good idea. There's no natural total ordering on vector spaces like there is on the real line, which is what this scheduler assumes. all() would be as good as any() for this, and I don't see why should we choose this for the users. It all depends on the use case.
body_text: I don't think this is a good idea. There's no natural total ordering on vector spaces like there is on the real line, which is what this scheduler assumes. all() would be as good as any() for this, and I don't see why should we choose this for the users. It all depends on the use case.
body: I don't think this is a good idea. There's no natural total ordering on vector spaces like there is on the real line, which is what this scheduler assumes. `all()` would be as good as `any()` for this, and I don't see why should we choose this for the users. It all depends on the use case.
